dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Kaspi.kz just had a meeting with the President, and they're some pretty impressive numbers—like 710 thousand entrepreneurs using their platform.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: the website just had a meeting with the President, and they're some pretty impressive numbers-like seven hundred ten thousand entrepreneurs using their platform.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: According to the information presented to the Head of State, today about 700 thousand domestic entrepreneurs are developing their businesses using technologies from Kaspi.kz.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Oh wow, that's a huge number of small businesses relying on their tech. And I think they mentioned something about non-cash payments too, right?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh wow, that's a huge number of small businesses relying on their tech. And I think they mentioned something about non-cash payments too, right?

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, in just the first half of 2023, non-cash payments hit 11.8 trillion tenge. That's… uh, massive for such a short period.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, in just the first half of twenty twenty three, non-cash payments hit eleven point eight trillion tenge. That's... uh, massive for such a short period.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In just the first 6 months of 2024, non-cash payments for goods and services amounted to 12 trillion tenge and 150 thousand individual entrepreneurs were registered.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: And over 145 thousand individual entrepreneurs registered in that same timeframe? That's like, explosive growth for sure.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And over one hundred forty five thousand individual entrepreneurs registered in that same timeframe? That's like, explosive growth for sure.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In just the first 6 months of 2024, non-cash payments for goods and services amounted to 12 trillion tenge and 150 thousand individual entrepreneurs were registered.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. And it's not just payments—they're helping with taxes too. Over 1 trillion tenge in taxes were paid through their online services.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. And it's not just payments-they're helping with taxes too. Over one trillion tenge in taxes were paid through their online services.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Over the first 6 months of 2024, more than 1.1 trillion tenge in taxes and other payments to the budget were made in this way.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: So they're really partnering with government departments to make things smoother. That's smart, 'cause tax stuff can be such a headache for small biz owners.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So they're really partnering with government departments to make things smoother. That's smart, 'cause tax stuff can be such a headache for small biz owners.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Kazakhstanis can pay taxes on time using online services created jointly between Kaspi.kz and the relevant government departments.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: For real. And the President actually expressed support for Kaspi.kz shareholders, which is a pretty big deal.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: For real. And the President actually expressed support for the website shareholders, which is a pretty big deal.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The President noted the importance of further assistance to small and medium-sized businesses in Kazakhstan and in this regard expressed his support to the shareholders of Kaspi.kz.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, especially since he emphasized how important SMEs are for Kazakhstan's economy. It's cool to see private and public sectors working together like this.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, especially since he emphasized how important SMEs are for Kazakhstan's economy. It's cool to see private and public sectors working together like this.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The President noted the importance of further assistance to small and medium-sized businesses in Kazakhstan and in this regard expressed his support to the shareholders of Kaspi.kz.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And you know, Vyacheslav Kim and Mikhail Lomtadze were there at the meeting too. They've built something really impactful.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And you know, Vyacheslav Kim and Mikhail Lomtadze were there at the meeting too. They've built something really impactful.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Vyacheslav Kim, Mikhail Lomtadze (left) at a reception with Kassym-Jomart Tokayev Photo: Aqorda

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Absolutely. Makes you wonder what new services they'll roll out next to help even more businesses.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Absolutely. Makes you wonder what new services they'll roll out next to help even more businesses.

artist_script:
HostA: Kaspi.kz just had a meeting with the President, and they’re some pretty impressive numbers—like 710 thousand entrepreneurs using their platform.
HostB: Oh wow, that’s a huge number of small businesses relying on their tech. And I think they mentioned something about non-cash payments too, right?
HostA: Yeah, in just the first half of 2023, non-cash payments hit 11.8 trillion tenge. That’s… uh, massive for such a short period.
HostB: And over 145 thousand individual entrepreneurs registered in that same timeframe? That’s like, explosive growth for sure.
HostA: Exactly. And it’s not just payments—they’re helping with taxes too. Over 1 trillion tenge in taxes were paid through their online services.
HostB: So they’re really partnering with government departments to make things smoother. That’s smart, ‘cause tax stuff can be such a headache for small biz owners.
HostA: For real. And the President actually expressed support for Kaspi.kz shareholders, which is a pretty big deal.
HostB: Yeah, especially since he emphasized how important SMEs are for Kazakhstan’s economy. It’s cool to see private and public sectors working together like this.
HostA: And you know, Vyacheslav Kim and Mikhail Lomtadze were there at the meeting too. They’ve built something really impactful.
HostB: Absolutely. Makes you wonder what new services they’ll roll out next to help even more businesses.
